title: Who Speaks for the Lazy? - tone paragraph 5

content.question: The author assumes a self-important tone in Paragraph 5 ("As a solid ... big answer") to

choices.label: express indignation, so as to distance himself from the lazy
affect seriousness, so as to conceal his indifference to the topic
chastise his audience, so as to reinforce his authority
mock himself, so as to build credibility with his audience

content.answer: mock himself, so as to build credibility with his audience

skill.text: Skill 7.A: Explain how word choice, comparisons, and syntax contribute to the specific tone or style of a text.
